_source.text: 38 Eric Larson applied this argument to the surveys originally analyzed by Mueller, as well as public opinion from subsequent wars, and found, contra Mueller, that the complex cost-benefit calculation fit the data better than a reflexive, logarithmic response.

_source.text: A couple of years back, probably with an eye toward trying to plant the seed for a move to Texas from the cranky, cold, socialist Northeast, I mentioned to my wife that I had read ("on that evil, racist blog I read sometimes, just to marvel at the depravity of its purveyor...") that white kids in Texas did better than those in the rest of the country on some standardized test.
